definition: to explode or burst/to quick fry or quick boil
to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳

sentences.english: Prolonged pressure caused the sternum to snap in half and the ribs to break.
sentences.chinese: 大型瓦斯罐由於受到爆震波的壓擠破裂倒塌了。

sentences.english: Objective To study the clinical effects of fortified iron nutrition on blast exposure hearing damage.
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察強化鐵營養防治爆震性聾的臨牀初步療效。

sentences.english: The experimental results show that knock is caused by end gas autoignition.
sentences.chinese: 自燃通常會，但並不總是引起爆震。

sentences.english: As an example, the isobars are plotted for strong detonation waves passing over a wedge surface.
sentences.chinese: 作爲例子，文中計算了強爆震波繞薄楔時的等壓線。

sentences.english: He diagnosed the trouble that caused the engine knock.
sentences.chinese: 他查出了引起發動機發出爆震聲故障的原因。

sentences.english: The detonation pressure and velocity for gasoline/ water emulsion is smaller than those for straight-run gasoline.
sentences.chinese: 滲水乳化汽油的爆震壓力和速度低於直餾無鉛汽油。

sentences.english: The straight-chain alkanes exacerbate the problem of engine "knock".
sentences.chinese: 直鏈烷烴使機器的“爆震”問題更加嚴重。

sentences.english: This paper studies the relation between knock and ion current of post-flame zone.
sentences.chinese: 作者研究了焰後區的離子電流信號與爆震的關係。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the organization and administration in the rescue of patients with blast injury.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討突發爆震傷救治過程中的護理組織與管理。

sentences.english: A war came knocking on your door.
sentences.chinese: 一個戰爭受到在你的門上爆震音的影響。

sentences.english: Knock control and misfire prevention software will be offered as upgrades.
sentences.chinese: 爆震控制和預防失火軟件將提供作爲升級。

sentences.english: In this paper, a fractal based knock threshold detection method is presented.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一種利用分形幾何檢測汽油機爆震邊緣的方法。

definition: valve (esp. tire valve)/accelerator (obsolete term for 油門|油门)/stigma (zool.)/spiracle
cylinder (of steam engine or internal combustion engine)
power output (of an electrical device etc)
to temper (iron)/to flare back/flareback (in a gas burner)/(of an engine) to backfire
